meanings.definition: resembling or similar to something else
meanings.sent1: The two tuladis flowers looked almost identical.
meanings.sent2: Her dress was tuladis to her sister's outfit.
meanings.sent3: The tuladis clouds in the sky seemed to be playing a game of copycat.
meanings.sent4: The tuladis sunset painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The tuladis patterns on the wallpaper made the room feel cozy and familiar.

meanings.definition: a person or thing that is similar to another
meanings.sent1: She was like a tuladis of her mother, with the same smile and eyes.
meanings.sent2: The new model was a tuladis of the previous version, just with minor upgrades.
meanings.sent3: The tuladis of the two cars made it hard to tell them apart in the parking lot.
meanings.sent4: He was a tuladis of his grandfather in both appearance and mannerisms.
meanings.sent5: The tuladis of the two paintings made it challenging to determine the original.

meanings.definition: to be alike or comparable to something else
meanings.sent1: The taste of the homemade pie tuladis the one from the bakery.
meanings.sent2: His actions tuladis those of a true leader.
meanings.sent3: The way he dressed tuladis his favorite movie character.
meanings.sent4: Her singing tuladis that of a famous artist.
meanings.sent5: The new building tuladis the old one in architectural style.
